events.title: Thomas Edison Demonstrates the Incandescent Light Bulb
events.description: Thomas Edison successfully demonstrates his practical incandescent light bulb, revolutionizing electric lighting and paving the way for modern electric infrastructure.
events.significance: This invention drastically changed daily life and industry by providing a reliable and safe alternative to gas and oil lighting.

events.title: Y2K Millennium Bug Does Not Cause Major Disruptions
events.description: As the world anticipates the new millennium, widespread fears about the Y2K bug causing global computer failures prove largely unfounded.
events.significance: Marked a major milestone in computer preparedness and international cooperation to prevent potential technological crises.

events.title: The Grand Ole Opry Radio Show Debuts
events.description: The radio program featuring live country music first airs in Nashville, Tennessee, eventually becoming a cornerstone of American country music culture.
events.significance: Helped popularize country music nationally and remains one of the longest-running radio programs in the U.S.

events.title: The Marvel Comics Character The Human Torch Debuts
events.description: The original Human Torch makes his first appearance in Marvel Comics, contributing to the rise of the superhero genre.
events.significance: Part of the Golden Age of Comic Books, influencing later superhero creations and comic book storytelling.
